trans-unit.source: Represents a peer for which a user has retrieved extended information.
A contact represents a trusted peer.

A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object must be created for a remote peer or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe> for a user to collaborate with the remote peer when it is outside of the "People Near Me" scope.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object can exist as either an application running on a remote computer, or the user of a remote computer.
An instance of this class can be added to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> which stores the contact information in a persistent manner.
An application invitation from a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> is both authenticated and encrypted.
The UI dialog to accept or reject an invitation from a peer contact also indicates that that the inviter is trusted.
Subscribing to a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object means a remote peer can see its registered applications, objects and presence information.

To subscribe to a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>, the caller must be signed in to the peer collaboration infrastructure via <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> or signed in via the Windows UI.
All other operations do not require sign-in.
No public constructor is defined for this class.

An instance of this object can be obtained from the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.GetContact%2A><xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.CreateContact%2A> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.FromXml%2A> methods.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
The serialization destination associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
This event is raised whenever an application associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> has changed.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets the X509Certificate (public key) for the peer identified by this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
The X509Certificate (public key) for the peer identified by this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
The default value for this property is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets a string which represents the display name of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.

A display name may be used to differentiate contacts in a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> in instances where a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> may have multiple email addresses, or if there are multiple peers with the same display name.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> which represents the display name of this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
Unless explicitly specified, the default value for all properties is `null` for reference types.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Releases the unmanaged resources and optionally releases the managed resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object.
When a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> leaves a collaboration session, certain objects are no longer required.

If this contact had been collaborating with any other endpoint(s) not directly registered with the peer host, and the host expects to continue to collaborate with them, the host must register those endpoints within an application or within its <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> before disposing of this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object.
`True` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the email address associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailAddress> object is used to represent the mail address.
The Contact Manager allows for multiple email addresses within one instance.
The default value for this property is `null`.
<xref href="System.Net.Mail.MailAddress"></xref> object that contains the email address associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
Normalization does not occur on the strings prior to comparison.
All normalization should have been completed while or before constructing the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> objects.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance to test for equality.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance provided has matching data, else `false`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance to the specified object.

Other objects that may be compared with <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> objects include peer host names, relative peer names, and names de-encapsulated from other <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer> objects.
Normalization does not occur on the strings prior to comparison.
All normalization should have been completed while or before constructing the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> objects.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance to the specified object.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance provided has matching data, else `false`.
This method also returns `false` if the passed parameter is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instances are considered equal.
This can be used to determine whether a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName%2A> is in use simultaneously by two different remote peers.

Other objects that may be compared with <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> objects include peer host names, relative peer names, and names de-encapsulated from other <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer> objects.
The first <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to compare.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instances provided have matching data, else `false`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance based on provided XML data.
The string to pass as the parameter should be obtained from <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.ToXml%2A>.
This class is intended to be a lightweight implementation of a simple XML object model for use within the collaboration infrastructure, and not for use as a general XML object model.
The XML encoding used to reconstruct the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
A string that represents the XML object model for encoding the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
Parameter cannot be `null.`
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.FromXml(System.String)"></xref> operation
Parameter is not a valid <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaborationPermission.FromXml(System.Security.SecurityElement)"></xref> object.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> objects that were registered by the remote peer into the local cache.

If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.

While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
This functionality is only exposed on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> class.
This functionality is not exposed on any other type of peer for security reasons.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationCollection"></xref> from the local cache.
If associated applications are not found for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>, a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
The calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The calling peer has not yet called the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> method.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications"></xref> operation.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> objects with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> from the local cache.

If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.

While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
This functionality is only exposed on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> class.
This functionality is not exposed on any other type of peer for security reasons.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> of the peer application to be retrieved.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationCollection"></xref> from the local cache.
If no applications are found with the specified applicationId, a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
The calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The calling peer has not yet called the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> method.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications"></xref> operation.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationCollection"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.

If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.

While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
This functionality is only exposed on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> class.
This functionality is not exposed on any other type of peer for security reasons.
Contains endpoint information associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationCollection"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
If applications are not associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>, a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> cannot be `null`.
The calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The calling peer has not yet called the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> method.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications"></xref> operation.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationCollection"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.

If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.

While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
This functionality is only exposed on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> class.
This functionality is not exposed on any other type of peer for security reasons.
The endpoint associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationCollection"></xref>.
Contains application information associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
The collection of <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> objects associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.

If applications identified by the ID are not found for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>, or if the ID for the endpoint is `null` or invalid, a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> cannot be `null`.
The calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The calling peer has not yet called the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> method.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications"></xref> operation.
Returns the hash code for a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
This hash code value is used to programmatically compare instances of this type.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
A derived type must call the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer.GetObjectData%2A> method of the base type.
Holds the serialized data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object.

Gets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObjectCollection"></xref> registered by the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> and stored in the local cache.

If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.

While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
The endpoint from which to retrieve objects.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObjectCollection"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
If no applications are associated with the endpoint, a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> cannot be `null`.

The calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The calling peer has not yet called the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> method.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects*"></xref> operation.

Gets the collection of peer objects registered by the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> and registered in the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> identified by the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.

If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> associated with the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> method must be called prior to calling this method.

While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData%2A> or one of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in.
The endpoint from which to retrieve objects.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref> to be retrieved.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObjectCollection"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
If no applications are associated with the endpoint, a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> cannot be `null`.
The calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The calling peer has not yet called the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshData"></xref> method.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects*"></xref> operation.
Sends the specified invitation to join into the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> sponsored by the sender.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> for which the invitation is sent.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation.
A user-defined data blob to associate with the invitation.
Its size can be no more than 16,384 bytes.
A <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse"></xref> from the peer who received the invitation.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> cannot be `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> for the current application does not exist or is empty.

Sends the specified invitation to the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> to join into the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration"></xref> application sponsored by the sender.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
The endpoint or remote peer to which to send the invitation.
The application for which the invitation is sent.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation.
The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user-defined data blob to associate with the invitation.
Its size can be no more than 16,384 bytes.
A <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse"></xref> from the peer who received the invitation.
Endpoint in PeerEndPoint cannot be `null`.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object cannot be empty.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> objects cannot be `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> for the current application does not exist or is empty.
Sends an invitation to join into peer collaboration sponsored by the sender.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
A <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse"></xref> from the peer who received the invitation.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> for the current application does not exist.
Sends an invitation to a specific endpoint to join into peer collaboration with the sender of the invitation.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
The endpoint to receive the invitation.
A <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse"></xref> from the peer endpoint who received the invitation.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> cannot be `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Invite"></xref> operation.
The currently executing application is not registered with the peer collaboration infrastructure.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.EndPoint"></xref> specified by <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object is not valid.
Begins an asynchronous invitation operation for an endpoint to join a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration"></xref> application sponsored by the sender of the invitation.
The invitation is identified using the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
User-defined object to pass to the callback of the asynchronous operation.
Also used to identify the asynchronous operation for cancellation.
This parameter must be specified and is unique across all asynchronous invitation operations in progress.
UserToken cannot be `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> for the current application does not exist or is empty.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection"></xref> cannot be `null.`

Begins an asynchronous invitation operation for the specified peer endpoint to join a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration"></xref> application sponsored by the sender of the invitation.
The invitation is identified using the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
The endpoint or remote peer to which to send the invitation.
User-defined object to pass to the callback of the asynchronous operation.
Also used to identify the asynchronous operation for cancellation.
This parameter must be specified and is unique across all asynchronous invitation operations in progress.
- UserToken cannot be `null.`
Endpoint in peerEndPoint cannot be `null`.
peerEndPoint object cannot be `null.`
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> for the current application does not exist or is empty.

Begins an asynchronous invitation operation for the specified peer endpoints to join the specified collaboration <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> sponsored by the sender of the invitation.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
The application for which the invitation is sent.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation.
The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user-defined data blob to associate with the invitation.
Its size can be no more than 16,384 bytes.
User-defined object to pass to the callback of the asynchronous operation.
Also used to identify the asynchronous operation for cancellation.
This parameter must be specified and is unique across all asynchronous invitation operations in progress.
UserToken cannot be `null`.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object cannot be `null.`
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> for the current application does not exist or is empty.
Endpoint collection is empty or `null.`
Begins an asynchronous invitation operation for the specified peerEndPoint to join the specified collaboration sponsored by the sender of the invitation.
The caller is not required to sign-in to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration> infrastructure for this method to complete successfully.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse> from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate.
If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.
The endpoint or remote peer to which to send the invitation.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation.
The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation.
Its size can be no more than 16,384 bytes.
The application for which the invitation is sent.
User-defined object to pass to the callback of the asynchronous operation.
Also used to identify the asynchronous operation for cancellation.
This parameter must be specified and is unique across all asynchronous invitation operations in progress.
- UserToken cannot be null.
Endpoint specified by peerEndPoint cannot be `null`.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> objects cannot be `null.`
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> for the current application does not exist or is empty.
Gets or sets a value specifying whether the current <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> is subscribed or unsubscribed to an endpoint.

Alternatively, this property gets or sets a value specifying whether the current peer host or hosting application has subscribed or unsubscribed to this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
In many instances, a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> is not the same as a peer host.
A peer host has an instance within the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> of the remote peer, and the relationship is that they have invited the peer to collaborate.
An endpoint has a "Me" instance within its own contact manager and the peer host, but the relationship is not specified.

If the peer host is in the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager>, and the peer contact chooses not to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A>, its <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscriptionType> can have a value of blocked, rather than deleting its entry from the host Contact Manager.
There is a many-to-many relationship between local peers, remote peers, peer hosts, and subscriptions.
Subscriptions are per user, rather than per process, per application, or per domain.
Consequently, the subscriptions associated with a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object are the list of contacts to which it has subscribed and from which it expects updates.

Those contacts either have updated their own application, object, and presence information, or they have updated information regarding contacts in the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager>.

This property always returns `true` if the object is a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> which represents the local or "Me" contact, since a contact is always subscribed to itself.
`True` if this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> is subscribed to this endpoint, `false` if the contact has not subscribed or has unsubscribed.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets a string which represents the Nickname of the .
A Nickname can be used for a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object in case there are multiple peers with the same display name.
A collaboration session can also use the nickname to designate remote peers commonly used in larger collaboration efforts.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> which represents the nickname of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
The default value for this property is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.

This event is signaled whenever a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> has changed.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Raises the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.ApplicationChanged"></xref> event.
Application changes occur when an application is launched, registered or unregistered from the collaboration infrastructure.
They also occur when peers join or leave a collaboration session or change network endpoint locations.
Peer scope changes may also effect a change in an application.
Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the event occurs.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ApplicationChangedEventArgs"></xref> object to be passed to delegates associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.ApplicationChanged"></xref> event.

Raises the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.ObjectChanged"></xref> event when a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref> is added, updated or removed by a remote peer.
Type of object change specified by <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ObjectChangedEventArgs"></xref>.

Raises the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PresenceChanged"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo"></xref> of a peer has changed.

Presence changes occur when a peer signs out of an application, an application is registered or unregistered from the collaboration infrastructure, or a peer unsubscribes from a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PresenceChangedEventArgs"></xref> object to be passed to delegates associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PresenceChanged"></xref> event.
Raises the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeCompleted"></xref> event.
Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeCompleted> event occurs.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscribeCompletedEventArgs"></xref> or <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscriptionListChangedEventArgs"></xref> object associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeCompleted"></xref> event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.

Whether a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> is a local peer, remote peer, or host peer for the peer contact represented by this instance is not relevant to the presence of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> in either the endpoint <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection> or the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> collection associated with this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
The default value for this property is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
No two contacts in the address book can have the same <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName>.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> which represents the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
Unless explicitly specified, the default value for all properties is `null` for reference types.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
This event is raised whenever the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> has changed its presence status.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.

Subscribes the calling peer to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>, and as a result, the peer will receive any future <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration"></xref> events associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
<xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> updates occur asynchronously after the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> method has succeeded.

As a result, it is possible for a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint> to be added to the collection of a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> before the associated <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.Name%2A> is provided.
To monitor these changes, it is recommended that the user subscribe to the relevant events; for example, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.NameChanged>.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
The calling peer is not signed in to People Near Me.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe"></xref> operation.
Failure may be due to an inability to establish a TCP connection to the peer.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> is exposed to the collaboration events associated with the peer or application that has ownership of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> in which this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object resides.

Setting this property to <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscriptionType.Allowed>means the remote peer specified by this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> can see the registered applications, objects and presence information for the user or application that owns the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> in which this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> object resides.
This property has no effect on a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> instance that represents the local or "Me" contact, since a contact is always subscribed to itself.

<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscriptionType"></xref> enumeration value that specifies whether this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> is exposed to collaboration events belonging to the peer host or hosting application.
Unless explicitly specified, the default value for all properties is `null` for reference types.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>
object has been disposed.

Asynchronously subscribes the calling peer to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>, and as a result, the peer will receive any future <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration"></xref> events associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeCompleted> event is raised upon completion of this operation.
If collaboration activities are not required to be asynchronous, the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> method should be used instead.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
A user-defined <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains information about the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeAsync(System.Object)"></xref> operation.
UserToken cannot be `null.`
The calling peer is not signed in to People Near Me.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Duplicate <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeAsync(System.Object)"></xref> identifier.
Raised when a subscription operation has completed.

When this event is raised, the error property on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.SubscribeCompletedEventArgs> object should be examined to determine whether the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.SubscribeAsync%2A> process completed successfully.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.

Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.DisplayName"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.DisplayName"></xref>.
Serializes the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to an XML string for persistent storage or network transfer.
An XML encoding of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.ToXml"></xref> operation.

Removes a subscription to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> and as a result the calling peer no longer receives <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration"></xref> events associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
If the calling peer is not subscribed to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> specified the result is a no-op.
A calling peer can verify whether it is subscribed to events for the peer identified by this instance with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.IsSubscribed%2A> property.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.

Implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable"></xref> interface and returns the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
Holds the serialized data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object.
